response:
Urgent neuroimaging is required to visualise the structural brainstem lesion. CSF analysis and comprehensive blood panels are necessary to differentiate between neoplastic (primary vs secondary), inflammatory, and infectious etiologies.

investigations = ["MRI Brain with and without contrast", "MRI Whole Spine", "CT Chest Abdomen Pelvis", "Lumbar Puncture", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Serum ACE", "Paraneoplastic antibody panel", "Anti-aquaporin-4 and Anti-MOG antibodies", "HIV serology", "Syphilis serology", "Vitamin B12 and Folate", "Thiamine levels"]
